REST API routes Route Auth¶

REST API repository Metho Contacts¶

async src.repository.metho_contacts.rep_create_contact(body: ContactPersonModel, user: User, db: Session) → ContactPerson¶
The rep_create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.
Args:

body (ContactPersonModel): The contact to be created. user (User): The user who is creating the contact. db (Session): A session for interacting with the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactPersonModel: Get the data from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contactperson object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.metho_contacts.rep_remove_contact(id: int, user: User, db: Session) → ContactPerson | None¶
The rep_remove_contact function removes a contact person from the database.
Args:

id (int): The ID of the user to remove. user (User): The User object that is being removed from the database.

Parameters:

  • id – int: Identify the user in the database

  • user – User: Get the user’s id

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

A contactperson object if the contact was removed or none if it wasn’t

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.metho_contacts.rep_show_all_contacts(skip: int, user: User, limit: int, db: Session) → list[Type[src.database.db_models.ContactPerson]]¶
The rep_show_all_contacts function returns a list of all contacts for the user.
Args:

skip (int): The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set. user (User): The User object that is requesting this information. This is used as a filter in the query, so only contacts associated with this user will be returned. limit (int): The maximum number of items to return after skipping &quot;skip&quot; amount of items from the beginning of the result set.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n records

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the user object

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contactperson objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.metho_contacts.rep_show_contact(id: int, user: User, db: Session) → ContactPerson | None¶
The rep_show_contact function is used to retrieve a single contact person from the database.

The function takes in an id and user object, and returns a ContactPerson object if it exists.

Parameters:

  • id – int: Specify the id of the contact person

  • user – User: Make sure that the user is only able to see their own contacts

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact person if it exists

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.metho_contacts.rep_update_contact(id: int, body: ContactPersonModel, user: User, db: Session) → ContactPerson | None¶
The rep_update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

id (int): The ID of the contact to update. body (ContactPersonModel): The updated ContactPerson object to be stored in the database.

Parameters:

  • id – int: Identify the contact person in the database

  • body – ContactPersonModel: Get the data from the request body

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in and has access to the contact

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contactperson object if the contact is found in the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

Nothing

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.
Args:

body (UserModel): The UserModel object containing the data to be inserted into the database. db (Session): The SQLAlchemy Session object used to interact with our PostgreSQL database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the user model from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed into the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The first user with the given email

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Get the user from the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

  • token – str | None: Update the refresh token in the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent
